info.name: iFrame Widget
info.summary: Display external Websites in a Dashboard Widget
info.description:
**🔲 iFrame Widget for Nextcloud Dashboard**
This app adds customizable iFrame widgets to your Nextcloud dashboard, allowing you to embed external websites directly within Nextcloud.
## ✨ Features
- **🌐 Embed any website** directly in your Nextcloud dashboard - **🎨 Customize appearance** with custom titles and icons - **🎭 SimpleIcons integration** using the `si:` prefix for thousands of brand icons - **🖌️ Colorize icons** with a built-in color picker - **📏 Adjustable height** for perfect layout integration - **📱 Responsive design** with extra-wide display option (2 columns) - **👤 Personal widgets** for individual user customization - **👥 Group-based widgets** for targeted content delivery - **🔧 Admin controls** for global and group-specific configurations
## 🛠️ Configuration
The widget supports three types of configurations:
### 🌍 Global Widgets Set up widgets that appear on all users' dashboards.
### 👤 Personal Widgets Allow each user to create their own personalized widgets.
### 👥 Group Widgets Create widgets that are only visible to specific user groups.
## 🔒 CSP Configuration
If you encounter Content Security Policy errors, you may need to adjust your Nextcloud configuration to allow embedding specific websites. See the full documentation on GitHub for details.
## 💻 Compatibility - Nextcloud 30 & 31
